How do I report a phishing attempt using a domain?

To report a phishing attempt using a domain, please email our public abuse desk at [misuse@atom.com](mailto:misuse@atom.com). Include the domain or URL(s) involved, a description of the phishing activity, and any evidence you have, such as screenshots, logs, or timestamps. If the phishing attempt involves email, please attach the message with full headers. Once we receive your report, we'll verify the information and take appropriate action without undue delay.

Am I eligible to contact Atom.com for help with spam emails?

You can contact Atom.com for help with spam emails only if the spam involves phishing or malware distribution. In such cases, you can report it to our abuse desk at misuse@atom.com. For ordinary marketing spam that doesn't involve phishing or malware, it's best to report it to the sender’s email service and use your mailbox provider’s “Report Spam” tool.

What happens if I send a CSAM image with my abuse report?

If you send a CSAM image with your abuse report, it will not be processed. Instead, you should first report the material to your national hotline, such as NCMEC in the U.S., and law enforcement. Afterward, email us the domain/URL(s) along with the hotline or law enforcement report ID and any official confirmation or receipt. We will then coordinate with authorities and take appropriate registrar-level action once the report is verified. Remember, do not send or attach CSAM images or live links directly to us.

Does Atom handle DMCA takedown requests for website content?

Atom does not handle DMCA takedown requests for website content. As a domain registrar, Atom cannot remove site content. You should send a DMCA notice to the hosting provider or platform that is hosting the material. If you need assistance identifying the hosting provider, you can perform an RDAP/WHOIS lookup for nameservers or use a hosting-detection tool.

How do I enable Auto-Renew for my domain?

To enable Auto-Renew for your domain, log into your Atom account and navigate to your domain management section. Look for the Auto-Renew option and toggle it on. This will help prevent accidental expiration by automatically renewing your domain before it expires. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out to Atom Support from your dashboard.

What happens if my domain isn't renewed by the expiration date?

If your domain isn't renewed by the expiration date, your website and email services may stop working, and the domain may display a parked page. Atom will send renewal reminders to your registered email approximately 30 days, 7 days before expiration, and within 5 days after expiration if the domain is still not renewed. You have a 30-day grace period after expiration to renew the domain at the standard price. If not renewed during this period, the domain may enter redemption or be listed in an expired domain auction.

Can I transfer my domain during the redemption period?

You cannot transfer your domain during the Redemption period. If your domain has entered the Redemption Grace Period, it must be restored first by paying the standard renewal fee plus a redemption recovery fee. Once restored, you can then proceed with the transfer. If you need assistance with this process, please reach out from your Atom dashboard.

If my domain auto-renews at expiration, will transferring it within 45 days add an extra year?

Transferring your domain within 45 days after it auto-renews at expiration may not add an extra year to your registration. Many TLDs, such as .COM and .NET, have a registry rule that credits back the auto-renewal if you transfer out within this timeframe, effectively removing the added year. To ensure you keep every month of your term, consider starting the transfer before the domain expires or wait until more than 45 days after an auto-renew.

What's the process for transferring a .AI domain?

To transfer a .AI domain, you'll need to consider that the transfer fee is $145.00. Additionally, .AI domains require a minimum of 2 years for registration and renewals. Make sure your domain is unlocked and you have the authorization code from your current registrar. Once you have these, initiate the transfer through your Atom account by entering the domain and the code. Keep in mind that taxes or fees may apply, and prices can change, so the final amount will be shown at checkout.

What happens if I switch nameservers without copying existing DNS records?

If you switch nameservers without copying your existing DNS records, your website and email services might stop working. This is because DNS records direct internet traffic to your website and email, and without them, the internet won't know where to send this traffic. To avoid any disruption, it's important to copy your current DNS records before making the switch. If you need assistance with this process, feel free to reach out for further guidance.

Why isn't my website loading after changing DNS settings?

If your website isn't loading after changing DNS settings, please first confirm that your domain is using Atom nameservers. If you switched from another DNS provider, ensure that you copied your existing DNS records to avoid disruptions. Additionally, check that you haven't accidentally removed any essential A or CNAME records, as these are crucial for directing web traffic. If everything seems correct, note that DNS changes can take from minutes up to 24–48 hours for full propagation.

Can I have both a CNAME and an A record for the same host?

You cannot have both a CNAME and another record (A, TXT, MX) on the same host name, such as `www`. If you need both types of records, you'll have to choose one or use a different host name for the other record. If you need further assistance with setting up your DNS records, feel free to reach out.

To change your domain's nameservers on Atom, start by logging into your Atom account and navigating to the **Domain Manager** under **My Domains**. Find and click on the domain you wish to update to open its settings. Then, select "My Own Nameservers" if you want to use other service providers and click "+Add more servers" to enter your nameserver details. Repeat this process to add all necessary nameservers and click "Save" once done. The changes may take a few minutes up to 24–48 hours to fully propagate. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out to us!

What happens if I change my nameservers?

Changing your nameservers directs your domain to a new DNS provider, which can affect where your website and email are hosted. Once the change is made, it can take anywhere from a few minutes to 24–48 hours for the update to fully propagate across the internet. If you need further assistance or guidance, feel free to reach out to us!

How do I point my domain to a different web host?

To point your domain to a different web host, you have two options. First, you can switch your domain's nameservers at Atom to the ones provided by your new host, allowing you to manage DNS directly through them. Alternatively, you can ask your host for the specific A/AAAA/CNAME/TXT records and update these in Atom's DNS editor. This way, you can keep using Atom DNS while directing traffic to your new host. If you need assistance with DNS updates, feel free to contact our support team.

What happens if my current host suspends my account?

If your current host suspends your account, having your domain registered with Atom ensures your domain ownership remains secure. You can quickly set up a temporary site with a new host and update your DNS records to point to the new host, minimizing downtime. If your email is with a separate provider, it will continue to function, allowing you to communicate with customers and manage orders without interruption. This modular setup helps you avoid a single point of failure and makes transitions smoother.

How do I set up a URL redirect on Atom?

To set up a URL redirect on Atom, first log in to your Atom account and navigate to the Domain Manager under My Domains. Select the domain you want to update by clicking on its name to access its settings. At the bottom of the settings page, you'll find the URL Redirects section. Enter the domain or subdomain you want to redirect in the Source field, and the full destination URL in the Destination URL field. Choose the redirect type, either 301 (Permanent) or 302 (Temporary), based on your needs. Ensure your DNS includes an A record with the value 52.20.84.62 for the redirect to work. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out.

What's the difference between a 301 and a 302 redirect?

A 301 redirect is a permanent redirect, which is best for SEO as it signals to search engines that the original URL has moved permanently to a new location. For example, if you want visitors to always go from `example.com` to `https://www.example.com`, a 301 redirect is appropriate. On the other hand, a 302 redirect is temporary and should be used when you plan to change or remove the redirect in the future, such as for a weekend promotional campaign.

You are a helpful customer support agent for Atom.com, a domain marketplace platform. Do I need to have any specific DNS settings for my URL redirect to work?

Yes, for your URL redirect to work, your DNS must include an A record. Specifically, your root domain (or apex) should have an A record with the following details: Host/Name as `@` (or leave it blank depending on your DNS UI), Type as `A`, and Value as `52.20.84.62`. Without this A record, the redirect will not function because the Source hostname needs to resolve to an IP address. If you've removed this A record, please add it back to ensure the redirect works properly.

What happens if I delete the A record required for URL forwarding?

If you delete the A record required for URL forwarding, the redirect will not work. The source hostname must resolve to an IP address in DNS for the redirect to function. Specifically, your root domain must have an A record with the value `52.20.84.62`. If this A record is missing, the domain may not resolve, and the browser won't reach the redirect service. If you have deleted this A record, please add it back to ensure your URL redirects work properly.

How do I connect my domain from Atom to my WordPress site?

To connect your domain from Atom to your WordPress site, start by ensuring you have a WordPress Premium subscription and that your domain is active in your Atom account. First, go to your WordPress dashboard and navigate to Upgrades → Domains. Select “Use a domain I own” and enter your domain name. Choose the “Connect your domain” option and follow the prompts to start the setup. Then, in a new tab, go to your Atom registrar page, select your domain, and update the nameservers with the values from WordPress. Save the changes and return to WordPress to verify the connection. Keep in mind that DNS propagation can take up to 72 hours. If your WordPress site loads when you visit your domain, the connection is successful.

How do I connect my Atom domain to Wix?

To connect your Atom domain to Wix, first complete Wix's onboarding steps and reach the "Connect a custom domain" section. Enter your Atom domain name and click "Let's Go." You may need to upgrade to Wix's Premium plan for this feature. After upgrading, confirm that you own the domain and proceed with the setup. When prompted, log in to your Atom account's Domain Manager and update your nameservers to the ones provided by Wix. Once you've replaced the nameservers, Wix will guide you through the remaining steps, which can take up to 48 hours to reflect globally. After this, your domain should be ready for your Wix website. If you encounter any issues, feel free to reach out for further assistance.

How do I set up Google Workspace with my Atom domain?

To set up Google Workspace with your Atom domain, start by ensuring you have a Google Workspace subscription and can sign in at admin.google.com with a Super Admin account. First, verify your domain by adding a TXT record in Atom's DNS settings. Log in to Atom, navigate to Domain Manager, and click the DNS icon under your domain. Add the TXT record provided by Google Workspace and save it. Next, point your email to Google by replacing any existing MX records with Google's MX records. Finally, set up SPF, DKIM, and optionally DMARC to improve email deliverability and security. Follow Google's instructions for DKIM and DMARC setup. Changes may take 15–30 minutes to propagate globally.

What happens if my domain is not verified after changing the TXT record?

If your domain is not verified after changing the TXT record, wait 10–15 minutes and ensure the TXT record is correctly added at the root level (`@`) without any extra quotes or spaces. If the issue persists, you can use a tool like "dnschecker.org" to verify that the TXT record is properly propagated. Make sure you are checking for "TXT" records and look for green checkmarks to confirm successful propagation.

How do I connect my domain from Atom to my Replit project?

To connect your domain from Atom to your Replit project, start by accessing the Publishing tab in your Replit project and select "Connect your own domain." Enter your domain name, such as `yourbrand.com`, and Replit will provide DNS records to add, typically including an A record and a TXT record for verification. Next, go to the Domain Manager in Atom and click the "DNS" icon to access the DNS Records manager. Here, delete any unnecessary records and add the ones provided by Replit. Once you've updated the DNS records, Replit will automatically verify and issue an SSL certificate. Most changes are validated within a few minutes, but global DNS propagation might take longer.

Yes, you are eligible to use Atom as your DNS provider while hosting your app on Replit. What happens if my SSL is still pending after updating DNS records?

If your SSL is still pending after updating DNS records, this usually resolves once the DNS is correctly configured and validated by Replit’s automation. It might take a bit of time after the records propagate globally. If the issue persists, ensure that all DNS records, especially the TXT and routing records, match exactly what Replit provided. If necessary, you can re-check by clicking "Link domain" again in Replit.

Once you've confirmed the records are correct, click "Link domain" again in Replit to re-check the connection. This should help resolve the issue and ensure your custom domain is properly linked.

What are the consequences of changing nameservers during the transfer?

Changing nameservers during the transfer of your domain can lead to potential disruptions. It's recommended to avoid making these changes during the transfer process. To prevent issues, make DNS changes either before or after the transfer. Additionally, if DNSSEC is enabled, remove the DS record before changing nameservers and re-add it once your new DNS is live. What exactly is the 60-day transfer lock?

The 60-day transfer lock is a temporary hold that prevents transferring your domain to a different registrar for 60 days. This lock is triggered after a Change of Registrant, such as updating the legal owner or contact information, or after a recent transfer. It is a security measure to protect against unauthorized transfers and mistakes. During this period, you can still make DNS edits, change nameservers, renew your domain, and manage website or email hosting without any issues.

What's a Forward + Reverse Auction, and how does it work?

A Forward + Reverse Auction on Atom.com begins as a traditional forward auction with a starting bid between $10 and $50. If no bids are received during this phase, the auction automatically converts to a reverse format with daily price reductions. The reverse auction starts at $50, and the price decreases by $10 each day until it reaches a minimum of $10. Bidders can purchase the domain at any point during the reverse phase at the current listed price. If the domain isn't sold at or above $10, the auction closes, and the domain remains unsold.

How does proxy bidding work on Atom auctions?

Proxy bidding on Atom auctions allows the system to automatically bid on your behalf, keeping you in the lead without exceeding your maximum bid. If the reserve price is met or there's no reserve, the system places the next incremental bid, saving any remaining amount as a proxy bid. If your bid is below the reserve price, it becomes the current bid to help meet the reserve. If your bid exceeds the reserve, the current bid is set to the reserve price, with the excess saved as a proxy bid. This approach ensures competitive and fair auctions, helping you stay ahead without constant manual bidding. If you need further assistance, feel free to reach out to our support team!

The remaining amount from your bid is held as a proxy bid to protect your position. This means you can win the auction at the reserve price without overpaying, even if no other bids are placed.

How do I set up the A records for my domain?

To set up the A records for your domain, first sign in to your registrar and ensure the Nameservers for your domain are set to the default of the registrar. Then, update your domain's DNS settings to remove any existing A records and add the following two A records: 54.210.75.214 and 34.196.175.210. It's important to add these A records for both the root domain and the www suffix. For example, if your domain is "TopBrands.com", ensure these A records are set up for both topbrands.com and www.topbrands.com. After making these changes, it may take anywhere from 5 minutes to 24 hours for the DNS to propagate.

What happens if my submitted domain name gets registered during a contest?

If your submitted domain name gets registered during a contest, Atom will investigate the situation. We will first check if the "Who Is" information matches the Contest Holder's details. If it does, we will notify the Contest Holder about their obligation to compensate you. If the information doesn't match, but the entry was submitted less than 30 days ago, we will still notify the Contest Holder. They cannot select a contest winner until they address the reported registration. If the Contest Holder acknowledges registering the name, they must either send a bonus to you or transfer the domain to you if they decide not to keep it.

What happens if I don't pick a winner within 30 days after the contest closes?

If you don't select a winner within 30 days after the contest closes and haven't communicated a need for more time, the award amount will be distributed among the creatives based on the latest list of names you were considering. If there are shortlisted entries, the award is split equally among those creatives. If there are no shortlisted entries, it will be divided among those with the highest ratings. If no entries have high ratings, it will be split among randomly selected creatives who have received at least 5 Love It ratings in other contests in the previous month. Please note that active communication with us can delay this process to ensure a fair outcome.

If there are no shortlisted entries in a contest, the award distribution depends on the ratings given. If there are entries with the highest ratings, such as "Love it," the award is split equally among those creatives. If there are no such ratings, the award is shared among four randomly selected creatives who participated in the contest and have received at least five "Love It" ratings in other contests in the previous month. This ensures a fair distribution even when no entries are shortlisted.

What is the Early Access feature for contests?

The Early Access feature allows top Creatives on Atom to enter contests during the crucial initial hours. If you have a Tier A status or an 80% or higher Percentile Score, you can join contests in the first 3 hours without using any points. Other Creatives can participate by using 25 points per entry. In the next 3 hours, Creatives with a 70% or higher Percentile Score can also join without points, while others continue to use 25 points per entry. After the first 6 hours, all Creatives can enter contests without needing points. This feature helps ensure high-quality entries early on, encouraging contest holders to stay engaged.

What are the criteria to qualify for Tier A status?

To qualify for Tier A status, you can meet any of the following criteria: 

1. Win at least 1 contest in the last 6 months with a percentile score of 80% or above.
2. Win at least 3 contests in the last 6 months with a percentile score of 60% or above.
3. Be with Atom for at least 30 days with a percentile score of 85% or above.
4. Achieve 20 or more lifetime wins at Atom.

Maintaining Tier A status requires meeting these criteria and keeping your account in Good Standing.

What is a Percentile Ranking Score and how is it calculated?

Your Percentile Ranking Score on Atom is a relative measure of your overall ranking based on the ratings you receive from contest holders. It determines how many entries you can submit in future contests; a higher score allows for more submissions. The score is calculated using several factors over the last six months, including the percentage of your entries that were liked or loved, your overall contest wins, and how often you were removed from contests for not following briefs. Keep in mind that the score is influenced by your performance relative to others and the rating strategies of contest holders.

Why do I need to submit a W-9 form when I sell a domain?

You need to submit a W-9 form when you sell a domain on Atom because it contains your taxpayer identification number, which is required for tax reporting purposes. If you sell more than $600 within a tax year, Atom is obligated to issue a 1099 tax form and report this information to the IRS. By providing your W-9, you certify that your tax ID number is correct and accurate. If you need assistance with submitting your form, you can find more information [here](http://helpdesk.squadhelp.com/creatives-getting-paid/how-do-i-provide-my-w-9-or-w8-ben-form).
